value.title: Is a parameter filtered in Power BI Paginated Reports???
value.excerpt: How do you know if a parameter was filtered in your Power BI Paginated Reports? Was a slicer used in the Power BI report that is using the Paginated visual? Adam shows you a way you can find out!  Create and use the paginated report visual https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/visuals/paginated-report-visual

value.title: Merging your data in a modern lakehouse data warehouse

Stijn Wynants https://twitter.com/SQLStijn  pyspark.sql.SparkSession.createDataFrame https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/pyspark.sql/api/pyspark.sql.SparkSession.createDataFrame.html

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Dynamically Filter By Today's Date
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to dynamically filter by today's date. Using a date table, you can create a DAX measure that can then be used as a Power BI report-level filter to dynamically filter by today's date within Power BI Desktop.be  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present

value.title: Power BI Pivot: Move Data from Rows to Columns #Q&A
value.excerpt: I am a huge fan of Unpivot (moving data from Column to Rows), but sometimes Pivot is your friend, when you need to move data from Rows to Columns. If you're getting this error "There were too many elements in the enumeration to complete the operation. " trying to Pivot in Power BI, watch this video.
